reviews.review: The good old classic, pick it up if you feel like it

Excellent jeu.
Malgré son cadre très simple et qui pourrait être incroyablement répétitif, l'humour, le décalage et le niveau de difficulté croissant permettent à ce petit simulateur de moteur physique de devenir absolument merveilleux.

Je n'invente rien de nouveau en gratifiant Portal de tout ceci, mais je tiens à rappeller qu'aujourd'hui encore il reste un très bon jeu.

Portal es un juego de puzzles llevado hacia una trama que no precisa de ninguna sipnosis inicial. No me arrepiento de haber probado una plataforma como ésta en la que no sólo basta tener lógica, sino intuición. Quizás lo único malo es su duración, y digo quizás por que te quedas con ganas de más pero a la vez piensas que es una historia que no debería dar para más.
Portal es uno de esos juegos que muy pocas veces veremos que fluye como la seda. No tiene una historia enrevesada ni la necesita. Además, para ser un juego de hace casi 9 años los gráficos siguen siendo impresionantes.
게임의 기본적인 구조를 잘 활용한 대작. 단순하고, 무겁지 않고, 직관적이고, 재밌다.
Un juego que te deja con ganas de muchisimo más. Para mí, juego perfecto.

Helps you improve your critical thinking skills
:D

There are a few games that I can recommend to everyone and will continue to recommend to everyone until the end of time. Portal is just one of these games-- where a gamer can fall in love and someone new to video games can find a challenging and engaging experience that tests your mind. Each level is designed to build up the gamer to feel confident that the challenges aren't impossible and by the end of the game you feel as though you're the only one that could have possibly thought of that particular answer... of course there are only a single answer for each level but Portal is built for you to enjoy every moment of the game. After all of these years, I still love to occassionally dive back into the game to quickly run through all of the levels to experience the game one more time.
Très bon jeu, mais là encore 2h15 pour finir l'histoire?
If you haven't played it and it's on sale, don't hold back. You'll love it

哨戒机器人太萌了

传送门2通关许久，看到一代打折便入手了，本作主体游戏时间不是很长。只要在传送门2有好的功底，本作的谜题较2代算是比较简单的了，我花了3个小时就通关了（高级房间还没有尝试）。一口气通关的的我表示快吐了，从未晕过3d的我第一次感受到头晕目眩的感觉。本作更像是2代的一个引子，2代由于创意工坊的加入，游戏丰富性有极大的提升，类似mel这样的大型创意工坊作品，也是2代经久不衰的缘由。本作当年虽然只是半条命的一个mod，这个游戏创意放到如今足以给予一个满分的评价。
总而言之，本作的游戏性相对于2代是被包含的关系，对于传送门有爱的玩家这部还是要入手玩一下的，毕竟G胖不会数3。

很早就买了但是现在才评测。这游戏把FPS做出了新的形式，各个谜题恰到好处，没有过于简单或者过于困难。而想挑战自己的玩家也可以进行挑战关卡，比如限制传送门数通关之类的。不过挑战关卡更多的是考验熟练度而不是用智力去解谜，这点是我个人不太满意的。另外，流程有点短。

思わず夢中になってクリアまでぶっ通しでやったゲーム。普段はパズル系はやらないんだが、これだけは別格。基本的には壁、床、天井等に一組の入口と出口を作れるだけだが、崖から飛び降りた勢いで背後の壁から射出、のようなアクロバティックな解法を考える必要があり、パズルが解けた時の爽快感が素晴らしい。あとキャラがいいよね
A true PC classic! Great gameplay combined with an intriguing storyline make for an unforgettable experience.

[b]Portal[/b] (Puzzle-platformer)

This is a title that most gamers have played, and if not played, have at least heard of.  If -- like me -- you are late to the party and have yet to play the game, this review is for you... and hey, there's CAKE!

There are tabs for the various options:

- Keyboard, where you can re-map keys
- Mouse, where you can enable the controller
- Audio, with separate sliders for Game & Music. [b] Subtitles are NOT the default[/b]. I highly suggest turning them on, as the mechanical voice is hard to understand.
- Video, where you can choose Full Screen vs. Windowed, Aspect Ratio, Brightness, Advanced, and Resolution (up to 1920x1080)

I was happy to find that the game is [i]mostly[/i] controller-compatible... The crouch function doesn't seem to be mapped, so if you're going to use a gamepad, use the Ctrl button on your keyboard to crouch ;)

The concept is simple enough.  You (will) have two guns, one that produces a blue portal, and one that gives you an orange portal.  In one, out the other.  Solve puzzles and move on to the next area.  Easy right?

Well... Yes and no.  The portals themselves aren't difficult to figure out, but you have to master the physics involved to truly progress in the game.  I had a hell of a time grasping the this point because I was so disoriented when I was falling.  Here's a hint: You need to gain some momentum if you want to make some distance when you exit the second portal, and oft times that means falling -- not just jumping -- through a portal. 

There is some platforming involved, and a variety of obstacles (of course, what kind of game would this be if there weren't obstacles?) in your way, both benign and deadly, and through it all is your ever-present narrator-guide.  I don't recommend muting her, as you'll miss out on both the ambience and a huge part of the story if you do (subtitles alone just aren't the same~).

But.. what story?  O_o The game is tagged story-rich, so I was surprised to find that there wasn't much of a story at all!  Sure it was interesting, but story-rich?  But then... finally... It all changed.  Sure it was something I was expecting, but things didn't pan out exactly how I had anticipated, either.

You will have to get through 11 chapters before approaching the end of the game, and as you complete each chapter, the Developer Commentary becomes available (accessible via the main menu.)  Whilst you're in commentary mode, you can't be damaged, but you also won't gain achievements.

Speaking of achievements, there are 15 to be had, and only 1/3 of them can be gained by playing through the game.  There are Advanced Chambers and Challenges available via the Bonus Maps section which is where you'll earn the bulk of your achievements.

It's easy to see the influences that this game has had on modern gaming, especially games like [i][url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/257510/]The Talos Principle[/url][/i].  [i]Portal[/i] is on the short side, but well worth playing if you enjoy puzzle-adventures, especially if you plan on playing Portal 2.

Amazing puzzle game! I only wish it had controller support, luckly JoyToKey lets me use my DS4 as a keyboard and mouse. I also have DS4 windows set up so that when i click the trigger buttons the light bar corrospondes with the blue or orange side of the portal!

Portal is, in essence, a puzzle game. You need to figure out the needed steps and the right timing to solve each room and advance to the next.

What makes Portal outstanding is the amazing atmosphere it surrounds the player with. The first person 3d view, strange yet charming narrator, adorable "sidekick" and wonderfully detailed level design make this so much more than a simple puzzle game. You play a story (in which you still have to solve puzzles). Although linear and sometimes in the background, the story is just the right amount of believable and creepy to suck you in.

Portal is one of my all time favourite games.

This is an awesome game! I just bought it and love it! I like the puzzel aspect of the game.
El juego mas sorprendente que jugue en mucho tiempo!!!

Just finished my first play through of this game. Took less than 3 hours but damn was it fun. Portal is an excellent, excellent physics-puzzle game. There are 19 levels and each gets progressively harder as you go. There is a slight story as you go through but it isn't a big feature of the game. The awesome gameplay carries the game and the last boss fight is insanely fun. 

Overall I'd give Portal and 9/10. Really recommended even for those who may not like puzzle games!

Sehr schönes und kurzweiliges Spiel. Leider ist dies nur die geschnittene Version. Ich hasse es eigentlich mich als Erwachsener bevormunden zu lassen, gebe aber trotzdem eine Empfehlung für dieses Spiel ab. Aber auch nur weil laut Schnittbericht nur ein paar Blutspritzer an den Wänden fehlen und das Spielgefühl dadurch nicht wirklich leided. Habe das Spiel für 2 Euronen im Sale erworben und muss anmerken, das dort Entwickler mit Liebe und Herzblut bei der Sache waren.
Keine Bugs, nirgendwo Probleme, Gespielt unter Win7 64 bit.
